headline: Dr. Oz Is Big Mad That He Was Asked To Quit His Presidential Council Post (Ditto Herschel Walker)
author: Matt Prigge
sentences:
Four sentences long, including a curt “Thank you,” it gave no reason for the requested resignation, simply asking for him to quit “by close of business today.” If he failed to do so, it read, his position would be “terminated effective 6:00 pm tonight.”
Did Oz comply?

pic.twitter.com/EP1vHWATp4
— Dr. Mehmet Oz (@DrOz) March 23, 2022
“Clearly, Joe Biden can’t be around anyone who doesn’t completely fall in line with his fear-mongering authoritarian one-size-fits-all COVID handling,” Oz steamed on Twitter.
Even if he clinched the nomination, he’d still have to face off against the state’s lieutenant governor John Fetterman, who’s both very popular and much more social media savvy.

pic.twitter.com/lvAiOu6JMJ
— Ron Filipkowski (@RonFilipkowski) March 23, 2022
Oz was one of two Trump-appointed members of the council to be asked to leave or be booted.
Dr. Oz’s bizarre decision to abandon a lucrative television career as a questionable health adviser to rebrand as a Trump clone continues to blow up in his face.
As per CNN, President Joe Biden has belatedly asked the one born Mehmet Oz to resign from the President’s Council on Sports, Fitness and Nutrition or be fired.
Meanwhile, in a Fox News survey of PA GOP voters from two weeks prior, Oz was trailing nine points behind fellow Republican candidate David McCormick.
Clearly, Joe Biden can’t be around anyone who doesn’t completely fall in line with his fear-mongering authoritarian one-size-fits-all COVID handling.
He’s also spouted nonsense about the pandemic that has overwhelmingly targeted Republican voters, despite being a licensed medical practitioner.
The other was Herschel Walker, the former NFL player, ex-MMA fighter, and current biological evolution understander.
Oz’s campaign has struggled to connect with Republican voters, despite him parroting Trumpian talking points.
Both Oz and Walker are running as Republican candidates for Senate, Oz in Pennsylvania, Walker in Georgia.

“I am proud of my service and will not resign.”
Either Oz made good on his word or he quietly resigned.
Mehmet Oz has just been fired from the President’s Council on Sports, Fitness and Nutrition.
Not only is he lagging in the polls, he’s now been booted from yet another prize gig.
Trump has formally endorsed Walker, while Oz at least has the blessing of Melania.
But for them to duke it out, Oz would have to actually get the nom.
The letter Oz received from Biden’s assistant was short and sweet.
He even appears to have lost Oprah, the person who made his name.
He refused, which likely means he’s been fired.
I am proud of my service and will not resign.
Either way, he’s out of another job.
Not publicly, at least.
Hope it was worth it!
(Via CNN)
